intro: Tradescantia koernickeana, commonly known as the spiderwort or red spiderwort, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, or white, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Tradescantia koernickeana is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and floral display.
